## Bio

Hi, I’m Nina Thècle Ahishakiye, a project operations and stakeholder engagement professional working at the intersection of development, governance, and global collaboration.

I have 5 years of international experience leading coordination efforts across 34 countries in Eastern, Southern, and Central Africa, driving efficient project delivery, multi-stakeholder alignment, and high-quality reporting within complex environments.
My work lies in creating order in high-impact spaces,  whether moderating multinational security conferences, streamlining systems that enhance productivity, or guiding culturally diverse teams toward shared goals.
I am currently pursuing my MBA at University Canada West, strengthening my strategic and analytical capabilities to shape global initiatives through modern governance, operational excellence, and data-driven decision-making.

## Education


- **Master of Business Administration (MBA)** — University Canada West *(Ongoing)*  
- **B.Sc. Community Health & Development** — The Catholic University of Eastern Africa  
- **Professional Certificate:** Psychology & Peer Counselling


## Professional Experience/ Highlights
- Orchestrated high-level missions and engagements across Africa and the EU — improving collaboration and timely execution.
- Managed research and analysis projects with actionable deliverables impacting 600+ healthcare institutions in East Europe.
- Launched education and public health initiatives that impacted communities and supported disease outbreak response.

- Project Management & Execution
